Dua tersangka kasus pembunuhan kabur dari penjara melalui lubang setengah meter
06 Nov 2019, 08:56 by BBC


Santos Samuel Fonseca (kiri) dan Jonathan Salazar (kanan) kabur dari penjara di Monterey County, California, AS.

Dua tersangka kasus pembunuhan, Santos Samuel Fonseca (21 tahun) dan Jonathan Salazar (20 tahun), menjadi buronan kepolisian Negara Bagian California, Amerika Serikat, setelah kabur dari penjara melalui lubang selebar setengah meter.
Dalam sejumlah foto yang dirilis kepolisian, tampak bahwa keduanya melubangi langit-langit toilet penjara di Kota Salinas, sebelah selatan San Francisco.


Bertukar posisi dengan saudara kembar, tahanan kabur dari penjara


Gali terowongan, empat narapidana asing kabur dari Penjara Kerobokan Bali


Terowongan rahasia ditemukan di penjara Meksiko


Kantor sheriff setempat menyebut Fonseca dan Salazar telah memanfaatkan "area yang luput dari penjagaan".
Mereka kabur pada Minggu (03/11) ketika sedang menunggu sidang kasus pembunuhan yang terpisah satu sama lain.
"Kami kecewa bahwa ada orang yang dituntut dengan tuduhan pembunuhan tapi tidak lagi berada di penjara kami," kata Jonathan Thornburg, juru bicara kantor sheriff Monterey County.


Lubang yang dibuat para tersangka di penjara Monterey County.

Aparat kini sedang mencari kedua pria itu, yang diyakini bersenjata dan berbahaya.
Kantor sheriff menawarkan hadiah uang sebesar US$5.000 (Rp70 juta) bagi siapa saja yang bisa memberikan informasi mengenai keberadaan kedua tersangka.
Bagaimana para tersangka kabur?
Kedua tersangka membuat lubang di toilet—tempat yang tidak bisa dipantau para sipir, kata sejumlah pejabat.
Lubang tersebut cukup untuk dilalui Fonseca dan Salazar—tinggi badan keduanya 1,7 meter. Keduanya kemudian tiba di area prasarana pemeliharaan yang dipenuhi pipa dan saluran.


Kedua tersangka membuat lubang di langit-langit toilet—tempat yang tidak bisa dipantau para sipir, kata sejumlah pejabat.

Mereka merangkak di saluran—yang beberapa bagiannya selebar 28 cm—sampai tiba di sebuah pintu kecil.
Pintu itu lantas dibuka dengan paksa dan mereka pun tiba di bagian belakang penjara. Aparat mengatakan lokasi itu tidak dilengkapi kawat duri dan pagar pengaman.


Kedua tersangka merangkak di area prasarana pemeliharaan.

Apa kasus yang membelit mereka?
Keduanya ditahan dan dijadikan tersangka tahun lalu dalam dua kasus pembunuhan yang terpisah satu sama lain, kata aparat.


Pintu kecil yang dibuka paksa kedua tersangka.

Fonseca dituduh membunuh Lorenzo Gomez Acosta, 37, dan Ernesto Garcia Cruz, 27, dalam jarak empat hari pada Juni 2018.
Adapun Salazar dituduh menembak mati Jaime Martinez, 20, pada Oktober 2017.
Keduanya mengklaim tidak bersalah, demikian dilaporkan Los Angeles Times.

Two murder suspects escaped from prison through a half meter hole
Nov 6 2019, 08:56 by BBC


Santos Samuel Fonseca (left) and Jonathan Salazar (right) escape from prison in Monterey County, California, USA.

Two murder suspects, Santos Samuel Fonseca (21 years) and Jonathan Salazar (20 years), became fugitives from the State of California police, United States, after escaping from prison through a half meter wide hole.
In a number of photos released by the police, it appears that they both perforated the ceiling of the prison toilet in Salinas City, south of San Francisco.

The local sheriff's office said Fonseca and Salazar had taken advantage of "an area which had escaped protection."
They ran away on Sunday (03/11) while they were awaiting trial for murder cases that were separated from each other.
"We are disappointed that someone has been charged with murder but is no longer in our prison," said Jonathan Thornburg, a spokesman for the Monterey County sheriff's office.


The hole made by the suspects in Monterey County prison.

Officials are now looking for the two men, who are believed to be armed and dangerous.
The sheriff's office offers a cash prize of US $ 5,000 to anyone who can provide information about the whereabouts of the two suspects.
How did the suspects escape?
The two suspects made holes in the toilet - a place the guards could not monitor, officials said.
The hole is enough for Fonseca and Salazar to cross — both 1.7 meters in height. Both then arrived at the maintenance infrastructure area which was filled with pipes and drains.


The two suspects had made holes in the toilet ceiling - a place the wardens could not monitor, officials said.

They crawled on the channel — some of which were 28 cm wide — until they came to a small door.
The door was forced open and they arrived at the back of the prison. Officials said the location was not equipped with barbed wire and safety fences.


Both suspects crawled in the area of maintenance infrastructure.

What are the cases that have entangled them?
Both were arrested and named suspects last year in two separate homicides, the authorities said.


The small door that was forced open by the two suspects.

Fonseca is accused of murdering Lorenzo Gomez Acosta, 37, and Ernesto Garcia Cruz, 27, within four days in June 2018.
As for Salazar, he was accused of shooting dead Jaime Martinez, 20, in October 2017.
Both claimed innocence, the Los Angeles Times reported.
